title: Drawing, "Design for a Cabinet in the "Boulle" Style", 1856–88
medium: Brush and black ink, wash, yellow gouache, brown watercolor, graphite on heavy white paper
inscribed: Stamped in black, upper right corner:  20
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: This drawing depicts an architecturally imposing cabinet in the "Boulle" style, veneered in ebony and symmetrically decorated with marquetry after Berain. Oval panels dominate the cabinet doors. Masked mounts and cartouches are additional decorative elements.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Cabinet in the "Boulle" Style", 1856–88.
1856–88. Brush and black ink, wash, yellow gouache, brown watercolor, graphite on heavy white paper. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 1988-64-1.
